description: Work on building and evaluating AI models for NLP, multimodal systems, and LLMs. Collaborate with researchers to enhance model performance and interpretability.

description: Support data-driven projects, perform exploratory analysis, feature engineering, and model training. Create visual reports to communicate insights effectively.

Conduct psychometric data analysis and design experiments to study human reasoning and decision-making.
Analyze employee data, identify engagement trends, and recommend data-backed talent strategies.
Gather requirements, interpret business processes, and design analytical dashboards for performance tracking.
Work with product teams to analyze usage data, identify user behavior patterns, and recommend product enhancements.
Evaluate voice or text-based responses using NLP tools to score grammar, tone, and fluency.

Build and fine-tune large language models and multimodal AI pipelines using open-source frameworks.
Implement scalable ML pipelines and APIs on cloud platforms. Focus on performance monitoring and deployment automation.
Clean, preprocess, and visualize large datasets to support decision-making. Communicate results clearly to business stakeholders.
Design and train models for text classification, summarization, and sentiment analysis using Transformer architectures.
Design and validate assessments to measure cognitive, emotional, and behavioral traits using psychometric techniques.
Develop models for automatic speech recognition and grammar scoring from audio samples.

description: Study bias, fairness, and transparency in AI systems. Design metrics and frameworks for responsible AI.
Create dashboards and visual stories from structured and unstructured data for leadership reporting.
Build deep learning models for detecting emotional states from facial or vocal cues.
Develop and test data models for recruitment analytics, candidate matching, and talent scoring.
Research AI-driven product ideas, create prototypes, and test them for scalability and ethical AI design.
